title: American Script Styles?
content:
i loved Ministry of Type’s post today:  
 [http://ministryoftype.co.uk/words/article/studies\_in\_pen\_art/#When:19:00...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023045824/http:/ministryoftype.co.uk/words/article/studies_in_pen_art/#When:19:00:39Z "http://ministryoftype.co.uk/words/article/studies\_in\_pen\_art/#When:19:00:39Z")

which led to this beautiful PDF, which you can find in jpg format on the IAMPETH website. [This page](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023045824/http:/www.iampeth.com/books/dennis_pen_art/dennis_pen_art_page19.html) makes me think that the names penned are illustrations of different pen styles, probably American. Does anyone care to provide any more information or divulge where i can read more about the various styles?

 [‹ Student Help \*Franklin Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023045824/http:/typophile.com/node/50700 "Go to previous forum topic") [Custom type design - growing or in decline? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023045824/http:/typophile.com/node/50524 "Go to next forum topic")
author: paul d hunt

comments.content: I can’t answer your question about the different pen style names, but, holy cow, what a nice find!

Paul

You may want to contact Michael Sull at

[http://www.spencerian.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023045824/http:/www.spencerian.com/ "http://www.spencerian.com/")

He will probably be able to answer your questions. I do not think he will be back in town until the 24th but he may be able to answer you on line.

Michael
